title: Learning Path
subtitle: Master Bitcoin Knowledge Step by Step

1.title: Economic Foundation
1.description: Understand the nature of money, banking systems, and economic principles

money.focus: Understanding the nature and evolution of money
keyPoints: Origin and historical evolution of money
Four functions of money: medium of exchange, unit of account, store of value, standard of deferred payment
Formation and problems of fiat currency systems
exercises: Research: Trace the history of your country's currency
Think: Why was gold once money?

banking.focus: Understanding traditional banking systems and financial innovation
keyPoints: Role of central banks and monetary policy
Development of Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDC)
exercises: Calculate: If reserve ratio is 10%, how much money can the banking system create?
Research: Causes and impacts of the 2008 financial crisis

economics.focus: Understanding economic principles and Bitcoin's economic properties
keyPoints: Supply and demand relationship and price discovery
exercises: Calculate: If annual inflation is 3%, what's the purchasing power of $100 after 10 years?
Analyze: Impact of Bitcoin's deflationary model on the economy

2.title: Technical Principles
2.description: Deep understanding of Bitcoin's technical implementation and operating mechanisms

computerScience.focus: Master cryptography and distributed systems fundamentals
keyPoints: Principles of hash functions and digital signatures
exercises: Practice: Generate a Bitcoin address using online tools
Calculate: If network hashrate is X, what's the attack cost?

gameTheory.focus: Understanding incentive mechanisms and security guarantees
exercises: Analyze: Why wouldn't rational miners attack the network?
Simulate: Design a simple incentive mechanism

energy.focus: Understanding the necessity of energy consumption
keyPoints: Proof of Work and energy consumption
exercises: Research: Bitcoin network energy consumption vs traditional banking system
Think: Is energy consumption a bug or a feature?

3.title: Social Impact
3.description: Understanding Bitcoin's profound impact from social institutions and philosophical perspectives

exercises: Research: Impact of El Salvador's Bitcoin adoption

keyPoints: What is value? How is value created and recognized?
How is authenticity defined in the digital world?
Philosophical foundations of individual sovereignty and freedom
exercises: Think: How would society function without centralized institutions?
Write down your understanding of 'trust', compare after completing the course
Case study: Research a Bitcoin-related legal case
Compare: Regulatory policies in different countries

milestones.checkpoint: Understand the nature of money and financial systems

stepByStep.title: Step by Step
stepByStep.description: Follow the recommended order, each stage builds foundation for the next

takeNotes.title: Take Notes
takeNotes.description: Record key concepts and your thoughts, review regularly

joinCommunity.title: Join Community
joinCommunity.description: Join discussion groups, exchanging ideas deepens understanding

practiceVerify.title: Practice and Verify
practiceVerify.description: Verify theoretical knowledge through practice to deepen understanding
